body_html: @apaszke That is why when you link the static library without whole archive, the compiler is permitted to drop the static initializers, right? I feel like we will be in good shape as long as we don't think this on the C++ level and instead keep tabs on our linker to not destroy our .init_array sections.
body_text: @apaszke That is why when you link the static library without whole archive, the compiler is permitted to drop the static initializers, right? I feel like we will be in good shape as long as we don't think this on the C++ level and instead keep tabs on our linker to not destroy our .init_array sections.
body: @apaszke That is why when you link the static library without whole archive, the compiler is permitted to drop the static initializers, right? I feel like we will be in good shape as long as we don't think this on the C++ level and instead keep tabs on our linker to not destroy our `.init_array` sections.
